node.title: Police say a simple knock helped find NSW's most wanted man
node.alt: Manhunt ends as alleged cocaine smuggler Mostafa Baluch caught
node.description: Mostafa Baluch had evaded authorities for several weeks â€” in the end, police say they used something very simple to locate the alleged drug smuggler.
node.content:
["Police say a simple knock unravelled an alleged escape attempt that triggered one of the largest manhunts in the country.", "It happened about 1am today.", "Police claim a Queensland constable tapped on the side of a truck that had just crossed the border from NSW.", "What happened next has led authorities to label the day as \"one of the greatest for policing in Australia\": according to officers, someone knocked back.", "When they searched the container\u00a0on the back of the truck, police say they found alleged drug smuggler Mostafa Baluch inside a Mercedes.", "The 33-year-old had been on the run since October 25 when he allegedly cut off his ankle tracking device while on bail.", "", "
An officer speaks to Mostafa Baluch earlier today.(Supplied: NSW Police)
", "He had been charged over his alleged involvement in a plan to import $270 million worth of cocaine from Ecuador.\u00a0", "Police feared he had fled overseas.", "He did not make it that far.\u00a0", "Police say they had been stopping trucks travelling through Tweed Heads overnight after receiving a tip off.\u00a0", "\"This information was quite fresh and it was acted upon as soon as it came in,\" Organised Crime Squad Commander, Detective Superintendent Robert Critchlow said.\u00a0", "\"They [police] noticed some suspicious items with the container which wasn't properly locked.\u00a0", "\"Famously, there was a knock on the side of the truck and he knocked back.\"", "Mr Baluch was arrested and remains in custody in Southport.", "Detectives are now travelling to Queensland to seek his extradition to NSW.", "While police are still piecing together Mr Baluch's movements leading up to his early morning arrest, last week officers raided two Sydney properties and seized cash, drugs, mobile phones and money-counting machines.\u00a0", "They also seized a black Range Rover with Queensland number plates after it was captured on CCTV driving through the M4 tunnel near Croydon only hours after Mr Baluch fled his Bayview home.", "Police claim Mr Baluch had been at some of those addresses.", "While Mr Baluch will now face the courts, he has already been dealt a financial blow with the home, which police say is worth $4 million and had been put up as bail surety, seized by the state.", "", "
Police arrest Mostafa Baluch at Queensland border
", "\"I think Matt Kean is going to be very happy today because the Treasurer will now get access to that money,\" NSW Police Minister David Elliott said.", "\"To say that the government is thrilled would be an understatement.\"\u00a0", "Police said they expected to seize more items.", "\"We've identified what we will allege\u00a0is a drug-trafficking syndicate, which we are now dismantling as a result of this investigation,\" Detective Superintendent Critchlow said.", "He said the arrest had \"opened opportunities\" for law enforcement.\u00a0", "\"The support and attention from the community really have turned the criminal element against him,\" Detective Superintendent Critchlow said.", "\"[Mr Baluch] became what we call as \u2026 'hot' and he attracted a lot of attention that was causing impacts for people he knows.\u00a0", "\"Mr Baluch has given us chances that keep on giving to us.\u00a0", "\"He's opened opportunities we didn't have before.\""]
